questions.question: The components of IT Infrastructure are ___________________

options.text: Users, Applications, DBMS, System Software, Network & Hardware
Computing systems, satellite dishes, ISDN lines, Radio towers
Concrete building, air conditioning, fire extinguishers, sprinklers
Large servers, desktop computers, laptops, tablets

questions.explanation: A. All information systems will have these elements as common to them since interactions will take place between them in such systems. This is explained in para 1.2. B. B, C and D are incorrect since they are not speaking of the common elements of any information systems but are various types of equipment alone (B), physical infrastructure alone (C) or merely various types of computing devices

questions.question: Auditors dealing with organizations deploying IT need to have ______________

options.text: Adequate working knowledge of IT hardware & software
Expertise in all areas of IT technology
Thorough knowledge on the financial aspects alone
Expertise both in financial and IT technology aspects

questions.explanation: A. C.A.s knowledge of IT technology need not and cannot be complete and total. They only need adequate knowledge to effectively audit the IT functions of an organization B. C.A.s cannot be expected to be experts in all areas of IT technology; this is not their role C. Knowledge of financial aspects alone in a technology oriented function like IT will not facilitate effective auditing of the IT function D. A C.A. cannot be expected to have thorough knowledge of both financial & IT technology aspects

questions.question: People, the most import element of information systems, comprise ________________

options.text: Users of the system in the head office and branches
All users of the system and all information system personnel
All employees except information system personnel
Employees involved with maintenance of the information system

questions.explanation: A. It does not exclude the people managing the IT system B. As brought out in paragraph 1.2.1, the scope of IT covers both the actual users as well as those involved in managing the IT system C. It includes the information system management personnel D. The actual users of the system are also to the IT system

questions.question: Application software is a collection of programs which ______________

options.text: Operates computer hardware & facilitates use of system software
Exclusively use for generating applications to govt. bodies
Addresses a real life problem for its end users
Helps users generate complaints to IT services dept. alone

questions.explanation: It is system software which helps run hardware & facilitates use of application software. Options B & D are also wrong & are not generic definitions of application software. As explained in paragraph 1.2.2, application software are programmes that help address business, scientific or other needs of its end users

questions.question: Hardware refers to___________________

options.text: All computer parts except those which are soft, made of glass or plastic
Devices performing Input, output, processing & data storage functions of a computer
All connecting tubes, hoses, joints, cables and pipelines carrying IT cables
All parts of the computer which are complex and hard to understand

questions.explanation: A. A, C & D are clearly wrong answers which have no relation to the definition in paragraph 1.2.6 B. As defined clearly in paragraph 1.2.6

questions.question: The basic sequential steps of the machine cycle performed by the CPU are _____________

options.text: Fetch, Decode, Execute and Store
Decode, Execute, Store and Fetch
Store, Fetch, Decode and Execute
Execute, Fetch, Decode and Store

questions.explanation: As defined clearly in paragraph 1.3.2 B,C & D are clearly wrong answers which contain the wrong sequence

questions.question: Cache memory ________________

options.text: Is a large, slow memory which is no longer used in computers
Helps bridge speed difference between Registers and Primary Memory
Is a virtual memory which is an image of another memory
Is a memory where only valuable, secret information is stored

questions.explanation: Cache memory is a small & fast memory very much in use even today. As brought out in paragraph 1.3.3 It is not a virtual memory It maintains copies of most frequently used data from main memories and not only for secret information

questions.question: Secondary Memory _______________

options.text: Is volatile memory with large storage capacities
Is non-volatile memory which is fast & responsive
Is non-volatile memory with large storage capacities
Involves higher cost per unit of information than RAM

questions.explanation: Secondary memory is not volatile. It is not fast. As brought out in paragraph 1.3.3, secondary memory is non-volatile, with large storage capacities. It is, however, slower than registers or primary storage. Its cost per unit of information is lower than RAM

questions.question: One Megabyte is equal to ___________________

options.text: 1024 x 1024 Bytes
1000 Kilobytes
1000 Bytes

questions.explanation: 1 Megabyte equals 1024 Kilobytes or 1024 x 1024 Bytes. All the other answers are, therefore, obviously wrong.

questions.question: Unicode _____________

options.text: Uses 16 Bytes for character coding & has replaced other major coding systems
Uses 7 bits for character coding
Uses 16 bits for character coding & has replaced other major coding systems
Uses 8 bits for character coding

questions.explanation: A B & D answers are, obviously wrong. C. Unicode uses 16 bits for character coding & has replaced other major coding systems as brought out in paragraph 1.4

questions.question: Implementing Hardware Monitoring Procedures ______________

options.text: Is expensive and not cost effective
Reduces Total Cost of Ownership & improves Return on Investment
Is cumbersome & time consuming
Leads to increased server downtime

questions.explanation: Pra 1.5.3 establishes that the other options are wrong & it makes sense to implement hardware monitoring procedures. As brought out in paragraph 1.5.3

questions.question: Some factors that affect the requirement & capacity of various hardware are ____________

options.text: Number of employees in the organization
Variety of markets in which operations happen
Nature of the products dealt with in the organization
Transaction volume, Computation complexity

questions.explanation: As brought out in paragraph 1.5.4. This para also establishes that the other options are wrong.

questions.question: A issue in retirement of hardware is security & disposal of data. Robust policies need to be in place for hardware retirement cycles, archiving of data, closure of licensing and/or contracts.

options.text: FALSE
TRUE

questions.explanation: As brought out in paragraph 1.5.5, this statement is factually correct

questions.question: Hardware Auditing ________________

options.text: Primarily encompasses hardware acquisition & capacity management
Should be restricted to the financial aspects of hardware usage
Is not as critical as software auditing which can be a more vulnerable area

questions.explanation: Hardware is a vulnerable area which needs to be closely reviewed by Audit. Hence, the other three options are not correct Paragraph1.6 elaborates on the criticality of hardware acquisition & capacity management as Areas of Hardware auditing.

questions.question: Software _________________

options.text: Software consists of clearly-defined instruction sets that upon execution, tell a computer what to do
Refers to all the soft parts of any computer system
Is not as important as hardware; a system can operate even without it
Are only those programs which convert machine language to English

questions.explanation: Paragraph 2.1 incorporates this definition. While option B is obviously incorrect, C is wrong since it would be impossible to operate any computer without software. D, too, is wrong since software plays a role much beyond that of converting machine language to English

questions.question: System Software _______________

options.text: Is specific to each application software and cannot be interchanged
Co-ordinates instructions between application software and hardware
Cannot be used for application development
Is not involved in I/O devices connectivity

questions.explanation: Definition as per paragraph 2.1.1. It is actually generic and can be used with any application (option A). It can actually be the basis for development of application development (option C). It enables I/O devices connectivity

questions.question: Application Software __________________

options.text: Microsoft Office is not an example of application software
Cannot be directly interacted with by end users
Is a set of software that performs a function directly for the end user
Can be directly used on a computer even without system software

questions.explanation: As clearly defined in 2.1.2. Microsoft Office is, indeed, an example of application software. (option A). A Aspect of application software is that it can be directly interacted with by end users (option B). Lastly, a computer cannot be run without system software as brought out in earlier notes

questions.question: An Operating System is ______________

options.text: An intermediary agent that manages computer resources among various processes
An application software which is in operation in a computer network
A new type of software which has been introduced in the latest computers only
A computer system which has been switched on and is in proper operation

questions.explanation: The definition is as per paragraph 2.2. As for the other options, an operating system is, obviously a system software and not an application software (option B). It is not a new type of software and has been an intrinsic part of all computer systems for long (option C). Though option D may not appear to be factually incorrect, this is not the sense in which the term Operating System is used in this context.

questions.question: State True or False : Operating Systems can be single user / multi user, multi processing or real time.

options.text: FALSE
TRUE

questions.explanation: This has been clearly elaborated in paragraph 2.2.1

questions.question: Processor Management refers to _______________

options.text: Management of the various processors by the Systems Executive
Training of the end-user for optimal user of computer systems
Optimisation of use of application software on a personal computer
Process or task scheduling carried out by the Operating System

questions.explanation: As brought out in paragraph 2.2.2, Processor Management is one of the roles played by an Operating system. It enables process scheduling. The Operating system is part of the main computer system and one of its roles is process scheduling. It has nothing to do with the management role of Systems Executives or with training of end users (options A & B). It is not relevant to application software optimisation (option C).

questions.question: Which of the following is performed by the Operating System ________________

options.text: Supports virtual memory by carving out an area of hard disk
Supports virtual memory on external storage device
Supports secondary memory by allocating an area of hard disk
Supports end user in carrying out specific functions

questions.explanation: The Operating System supports RAM by carving out an area of hard disk to create a virtual memory (option A). It does not do this on any external storage device (option B). The OS can only assist expansion of RAM space by carving out hard disk space, not secondary memory (option C). The OS is only an intermediary agent and does not interact directly with the end user (option D).

questions.question: Which of the following is a role of the Operating System ______________

options.text: Helps manage Data bases of various types
Facilitates use of spread sheets by end users
Manages device communication with respective drivers
Helps programmers to create computer programs

questions.explanation: One of the functions of the Operating system is insulating the end user from the peculiarities of each hardware device (option C). OS are not directly involved in use of Data Bases or spread sheets; nor are they useful for writing programs. One would need program development software for that purpose (options A,B & D)

questions.question: Fifth Generation programming language _________________

options.text: It comprises machine language & code
Is mainly used in Artificial intelligence
Cannot solve a problem without a programmer
It uses long instructions & is machine dependent

questions.explanation: Fifth generation programming language is the most advanced of the languages & is used in artificial intelligence. It is, thus, not based upon primitive machine language and code. It is also pre-programmed with options in such a way that minimum intervention of a programmer is required. It is much simpler and platform independent as compared to first generation programming languages (options A, C & D).

questions.question: What is the function of a Compiler ?

options.text: It translates Assembly language into Machine language
It translates statements of a program into machine code, line by line
A compiler translates a high level language program into a machine language program
It allows a user to create and edit files

questions.explanation: A compiler basically translates a high level program into machine code. It does not operate at the level of converting Assembly language into machine code or, like an Interpreter, translate into machine code line by line (options A and B) It is also not an Editor program to create and edit files (D).

questions.question: Which software controls, among other things, ownership assignment of all data for accountability ?

options.text: Access Control Software
Data Communications Software
Utility programs
Defragmenters

questions.explanation: It is access control software which is vested with the responsibility for assigning ownership of all data for purposes of accountability (para 2.3.2). Data Communications software generally assists the OS for local and remote terminal access (option B). Utility programs and defragmenters basically help improve computer efficiency and performance and have nothing to do with ownership assignment of all data.

questions.question: Access control lists in the OS manage OS Controls. The lowest level of control that can be exercised is, generally, up to :

options.text: The level of an individual directory
The level of a particular page in a file
The level of individual words in a file
The level of individual files

questions.explanation: Most systems are designed to exercise access control only up to the level of a file and not below. Hence the choice of D as the right option above and the rejection of the other options

questions.question: State Yes or No In a newly formed organization, the System Administrator is faced with requests for access to particular files from multiple users. On closer scrutiny, he finds that though the users are different, he is able to detect a pattern whereby individuals handling particular functions all seek access to the same files. The System Administrator is aware that, while the individuals handling these functions may change, the actual functions, by and large, are permanent. He feels that it would be simpler to provide access control for files to particular functions and would like to know the feasibility of doing so in the Operating system. What is your view ? Is it possible to provide access to Roles which could comprise multiple users, instead of creating individual access controls for each of the users ? :

options.text: Yes, it would be possible
No, it would not be possible

questions.explanation: Access control lists are widely used with Roles comprising multiple users. The individual users can keep changing depending upon the roles they take up. Hence, Option A above is correct.

questions.question: What is the first step in Software acquisition ?

options.text: Establish criteria for selecting and rejecting alternatives
Carry out Cost/Benefit analysis, including make or buy decision
Establish scope, objectives background & project charter
Determine supplier s technical capabilities & support services

questions.explanation: Without first establishing the scope and objectives, software acquisition may end up failing on fundamental aspects of meeting end user needs. This would be the starting point, therefore, for any acquisition exercise. The other options get ruled out by default.

questions.question: What is an Endpoint device ?

options.text: A device used as a pointer during Power point presentations
The Answer:-board or a mouse on a computer
A device which identifies the end of each software program
An internet-capable computer hardware device on a TCP/IP network

questions.explanation: Endpoint devices can be computers, smart phones, thin clients, etc. which have connectivity to the internet as brought out in option D. The very fact that they have this connectivity raises concerns of security with respect to possible leakage of information to the outside world or vulnerability to virus or other malicious software which may attempt to enter the system from the internet.

questions.question: What is Digital Rights Management ?

options.text: Management of binary digit codes in the system software
Technology used for preventing users from using the content in any manner other than that permitted by the content provider
Conversion of analog records to digital mode
Optimization of binary digit codes in application software

questions.explanation: Digital Rights Management refers to the control on use of copyrighted / IPR material and, hence, option B is correct. The other options are wrong.

questions.question: Does the Operating system need auditing ?

options.text: Yes; there is risk of the OS being compromised
No; the application software prevents direct access to the OS
No; the OS is a robust system which cannot be tampered with
No, it is adequate if the application software are audited

questions.explanation: Though, in the normal course, end-users to do not have direct access to the OS, they could find ways of by-passing the application software and reaching out to the OS. Unlike the application software which has high security features to prevent end users tampering with data which is not open to them, the OS is relatively more vulnerable since it sees all data as simple bits/bytes & cannot even distinguish between different types of data of different criticality

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct sequence of data hierarchy?

options.text: File, Database, Record, Field, Characters
Database, Record, File, Field, Characters
Database, File, Record, Field, Characters
Database, File, Field, Character, Records

questions.explanation: The sequence of hierarchy from higher to lower levels is clearly as per Option C and the sequence of hierarchy for the other options are, therefore, wrong.

questions.question: What are Characters ?

options.text: Characters are a group of bytes
Characters are a collection of bits
Characters are a group of 8 records
Characters are a group of 16 records

questions.explanation: Characters are at the lowest in the Data hierarchy and comprise a collection of bits (Option B). The other options are wrong.

questions.question: What are some of the major outcomes of the non-existence of an efficient database ?

options.text: High redundancy and low data integrity
Improved data sharing
Reduced dependence between data and application software
Better linkages between data originating from different sources

questions.explanation: An efficient data base can reduce redundancy and improve data integrity (option A). The absence of a database will hinder data sharing & increase dependence between data and application software. An efficiently configured database will provide excellent networking of data from different sources.

questions.question: What is a Database Management System?

options.text: A set of pre-loaded data relating to specific industries
Customer profile data used for managing an organization
Software for creation, control & manipulation of a database
Hardware specifically designed to handle databases

questions.explanation: A database management system is a software which assists in the process of managing a database as brought out in option C. It is not just a set of data or hardware as indicated in the other options.

questions.question: What are the major risks of having a Database management system ?

options.text: Reduced speed of access to records
High redundancy & duplication
Reduced data integrity
Cost and data security threats

questions.explanation: The major risks involved are the cost (including time for implementation of a new system) and increased vulnerability owing to centralisation of information as indicated in Option D. Contrary to what is stated in the other options, a database management system improves speed of access to records, reduces redundancy and improves data integrity.

questions.question: Which of the following is the logic typical of a Relational Database Management System ?

options.text: Records have a one to many relationship in parent/child format
Collection of one or more relations in two dimensional table form
Records have many-to-many relationship in network form
Data is organized in a tree structure, in hierarchical format

questions.explanation: The logic behind RDBMS is in table form with domain & entity constraints which ensure robustness of the system (Option B). The other options relate to the hierarchical and network types of database and are, hence, wrong..

questions.question: Use of integrity constraints and normalisation is strongly typical of which type of software?

options.text: Relational Database Management System
Network Database Management System
Hierarchical Database Management System
Foxpro, Excel systems of spreadsheet

questions.explanation: The use of integrity constraints and normalization is typical of RDBMS and not of the other three options.

questions.question: Which of the following defines the logical structure of the database, its relations & constraints ?

options.text: Internal Schema
External Schema
Conceptual Schema
Logic unit in CPU

questions.explanation: It is the Conceptual Schema which defines the logical structure of the database including its relations and constraints and not the other options indicated.

questions.question: Which of the following is a database language used to define & describe data & relationships ?

options.text: Data Manipulation Language or DML
Data Control Language or DCL
Data Definition Language or DDL
Excel and Lotus 123

questions.explanation: DDL is a collection of instructions and commands used to define and describe data and relationships (Option C). DML, DCL & the spread sheet softwares are not the appropriate answer.

questions.question: Which of the following are typical features of Data Definition Language?

options.text: Not used by Database administrators or designers
SQL commands dealing with data
Generally used by a common user
Used to define both conceptual & internal schemas

questions.explanation: DDL is a database language used by administrators and designers to define both conceptual & internal schemas. It does not deal with data but only with the structure. It is generally not used by the common user. Hence, only Option D is correct.

questions.question: Which of the following are typical of Data Manipulation Language ?

options.text: Cannot be used for querying the database
Used to retrieve, insert, delete or modify data
SQL commands which do not allow changing of data
Application software will not be able to access it

questions.explanation: DML is a database language used to query & manipulate data. Application software are able to meet user needs only by interacting with the DML. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: What is a Data Dictionary ?

options.text: It provides a definition of terms and data elements
A dictionary which facilitates conversion of bytes into numbers
A software which helps convert machine language to English
A software which helps convert assembly language to English

questions.explanation: It is the documentation of database providing detailed description of every data in the database. It provides a standard definition of terms and data elements (Option A). The other options are factually wrong..

questions.question: What are Meta Data ?

options.text: Metadata refers to data of large sizes, millions, billions, etc.
Metadata is data about one or more aspects of data
Metadata is data relating to meteorological parameters
Metadata is data that is universal to different types of software

questions.explanation: Metadata is data about data. It covers aspects like meaning, purpose, time & date of creation, etc. of data. Option B, obviously, is the correct choice. The other options are incorrect.

questions.question: Centralised Deployment Strategy involves _______________

options.text: Centralized database & de-centralized decision making
De-centralized database and centralized decision making
Centralized database & centralized decision making
Multiple server usage

questions.explanation: Centralized deployment strategy uses a central database with all user communication being directed to it. Decision making, too, therefore, gets centralized as a consequence (Option C). Such a strategy use of a single hardware/software platform & a single server; hence, the other options are not correct.

questions.question: An important drawback of Centralised Deployment Strategy is _________________

options.text: Vulnerability to single point of failure
Resource sharing of reduced order
Poorer economies of scale
Reduced security

questions.explanation: Centralized deployment strategy concentrates all its resources at one central point making it vulnerable to total system failure in the event of this central point being compromised in any manner (Option A). Resource sharing, in fact, is a strong plus point for centralised deployment. Similarly, this system has better economies of scale owing to use of large size hardware & larger number of software licences. Since everything is centralized, possibilities of leakages are reduced since the number of exposed points are lesser. Hence, the other options are not correct.

questions.question: An important feature of Decentralized deployment strategy would be _____________

options.text: Information systems would be more compatible
Reduced duplication of records, processes
Business strategy based localisation of database possible
Adequate centralised control through security implementation

questions.explanation: The single major advantage of decentralized deployment strategy is its potential for tweaking the database to suit local requirements (Option C). However, compatibility of information systems may take a hit since multiple versions could be involved depending upon the geographic or business segment-wise spread of the organization. Risk of duplication of records is higher since multiple versions at different locations may be involved. Centralized control and security management would also be to a reduced extent. Hence, the other options are not correct.

questions.question: A disadvantage of Decentralised Deployment Strategy is ______________

options.text: Less flexibility to cope with internal/external changes
Potentially higher CAPEX requirement
Slower system development
Information systems could be mutually incompatible

questions.explanation: A major disadvantage of decentralized deployment strategy is that, with de-centralized decision making, different tailor-made information systems may be created at different locations leading to potential incompatibility (Option D). On the other hand, given their de-centralized structure, they would have greater flexibility to cope with changes and can be developed/implemented quickly. Capex requirement could also be lesser owing ability to carry out changes in phases. Hence, the other options are not correct.

questions.question: The IT components of a Core Banking Solution Data Centre would mainly depend upon ___________

options.text: Number of employees in the Bank
Type of services offered, risk management & control requirements
Annual Business volume
Nature of software applications used

questions.explanation: The complexity of services offered including the response time, risk management objectives and control goals would drive the IT components of a CBS Data Centre (Option B). The elements in the other three options would have limited impact on the configuration of the data centre.

questions.question: A near site facility is _______________

options.text: A data replication facility
Disaster recovery facility
Facility for storing data of secondary importance
Facility for storing employee data alone

questions.explanation: A near-site facility is normally used as a data replication facility only (Option A). It would not be a prudent choice for a disaster recovery facility since, as a proximate location, the probability of its getting exposed to the same geographical risks is very high. In the usual course, no separate facility is created for secondary data or for employee data alone. Hence, the other options are not correct.

questions.question: Configuration Identification involves ________________

options.text: Identification of all Information Systems components without reference to version
Identification of software components of Information Systems alone
Identification of all Information Systems components in a system
Identification of hardware components of Information Systems alone

questions.explanation: Configuration identification involves identification of all versions & updates of both software and hardware. This facilitates continuous monitoring during the life cycle of the product & becomes useful at the time of any proposed changes in the components (Option C). Option A is wrong since it ignores the version, which is vital. B and D are incorrect since they are addressing either the software or hardware alone.

questions.question: Hardening of Systems is _____________

options.text: Use of robust hardware to strengthen the system
Securely configuring systems to minimize security risks
Optimising configuration of hardware systems alone
Auditing configuration of software systems

questions.explanation: Hardening of systems is the process of securely configuring computer systems to eliminate as many security risks as possible (Option B). It does not refer to use of robust hardware (Option A); nor does it limit itself to hardware alone (Option C) or software alone (Option D).

questions.question: In IT, a network refers to ________________

options.text: Two or more devices which are able to exchange data between each other
Two or more computers which are able to exchange data between each other
Minimum of 8 computers which are able to exchange data between each other
Several computers separated over a minimum distance of 100 metres from each other

questions.explanation: In IT, a network refers to two or more of any devices which are able to exchange data between each other; it includes devices like printers, computer terminals & other devices of communication (Option A). It is not limited to computers alone (Option B). A network could operate even out of the same building & there is no minimum stipulated distance between the devices (Options C & D)

questions.question: In IT, a node refers to ______________

options.text: Every junction of cables in a computer network
Every computer in a computer network
Each component in a computer network
Every internet device in a computer network

questions.explanation: In IT, a node refers to each component in a computer network (Option C). It does not refer to cable junctions (Option A). It is not restricted to computers alone but covers every type of device in the network (Option B). It is not restricted to internet devices in a network (Options D).

questions.question: The main reason for networking computers is _______________

options.text: Reduce hardware cost
Reduce software cost
Resource sharing and communication
Essentially, to increase speed of computing

questions.explanation: The main benefit of networking computers is sharing of resources and facilitating communications (Option C). Networking does not have the objective of reducing either hardware or software costs; nor does it have the advantage of improving speed of computing (Options A, B, & D).

questions.question: One major benefit of networking computers is ________________

options.text: Facilitating user communication
Compartmentalisation of data
Reduced computing power
Reduced software costs

questions.explanation: A. Facilitation of user communication is a major advantage of computer networking (Option A). Networking helps sharing of data and increases availability of computing power. It may not necessarily reduce software costs; in fact, they may increase on account of multiple licences being required for several terminals. Hence, the other options are not correct.

questions.question: Protocol, in IT, is __________________

options.text: The basis for allotment of new computers
Arrangement of employee directories
A set of rules for Communication between systems
Proper behaviour while using computers

questions.explanation: Protocol is a set of rules that makes communication possible (Option C). It does not refer to the basis for allotment of new computers, the arrangement of employee directories or behaviour while using computers (Options A,B, & D).

questions.question: Data transmission _____________

options.text: Can be only through a voltage signal & not through radio or microwave
Is always digital in nature; one cannot transfer data in analog form
s the physical transfer of data over a communication channel
Can happen only through a copper wire or optical fibre

questions.explanation: Data transmission is the physical transfer of data. It can be through electrical, radio, microwave or infrared signals. It can be over copper wires, optical fibres, wireless channels or through a storage medium. It can be either digital or analog. Hence, only Option C is correct and the other options are wrong.

questions.question: Simplex communication _________________

options.text: Always involves uni-directional transmission of data
Can involve uni-directional or multi-dimensional data transmission
Can handle two-way communication
facilitates return of error or control signals to the transmitter

questions.explanation: A. In simplex communication data always flows from one node to another it is always uni-directional. It does not involve multi-dimensional transmission of data. It also cannot handle two-way communication or allow sending back of error or control signals to the transmitter. Hence, only Option A is correct & the other options are wrong.

questions.question: Half Duplex communication ________________

options.text: has capability to send and receive simultaneously
is cheaper than the Simplex system
is costlier than the full Duplex system
has facilities to send and receive but only one operation can be performed at a time

questions.explanation: Half Duplex communication has the capability to both send and receive but with the restriction that only one activity can be done at a time. It is more expensive than the Simplex system but cheaper than the full Duplex system. Hence, only Option D is correct.

questions.question: Full Duplex communication __________________

options.text: Cannot handle two way communication
Is the most expensive method in terms of equipment cost
Cannot handle simultaneous two way communication
is cheaper than Simplex communication

questions.explanation: B. Full Duplex communication has the capability to handle simultaneous two way communication. It is like two Simplex systems put together and, hence, is expensive. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: Asynchronous transmission ___________________

options.text: Is a communication technique where signal timing is not used for determining byte boundary
Does not require start and stop bits that provide byte timing
Is not suited for applications where messages are generated at irregular intervals
Is faster since it does not require insertion of start & stop bits into the bit stream

questions.explanation: Asynchronous transmission involves the use of start and stop bits that provide byte timing. Hence, signal timing is not important & communication can happen between devices of dissimilar speed. However, speed is slower owing to the intervening start and stop bits. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: Synchronous transmission _____________

options.text: Does not place the responsibility for grouping the bits on the receiver
Is a communication technique where start and stop bits are not used
Requires no synchronization between clocks of the sender & receiver
Is slow and can handle limited data rate

questions.explanation: Synchronous transmission does away with the use of start and stop bits that provide byte timing. It shifts the responsibility for grouping of the bits to the receiver. It, however, requires synchronization of the clocks between sender and receiver. It is faster than asynchronous transmission and can support high data rates. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: What are the features of a Local Area Network (LAN) ?

options.text: Connectivity is established only as and when required
Its security is low and error rates high
It interconnects devices within a limited geographical area
Installation and maintenance is cumbersome

questions.explanation: LANs interconnect devices within a limited geographical area. Connectivity is ongoing and permanent. Its security is high and error rates low. Installation and maintenance are relatively easy. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: What are the features of a Wide Area Network (LAN) ?

options.text: A WAN comprises interconnected switching nodes covering a wide area
Connectivity is established on a permanent basis
WANs use only private networks
All devices in a WAN will have the same network ID

questions.explanation: WANs interconnect devices over a large geographical area using both private and public networks. The connected devices, therefore, could have different network Ids. Connectivity can be on demand or permanent. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: A characteristic of a Metropolitan Area Network (MAN) is __________

options.text: Can provide only for data transmission
Feasibility to service customers in a large city-wide area
Can handle only voice & video transmission
Higher cost than service from telephone company

questions.explanation: MANs play a role in meeting the growing needs of an organization with lower costs and higher capacity. It can provide for both data and voice transmission. Its cost & efficiency are generally more favourable as compared to telephone company services. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: Client Server architecture is characterized by ________________

options.text: Computational & interface-oriented logic are married together
Client process does not avail services of server
A dedicated server that provides resources to clients
Client executes in the same address space as the server

questions.explanation: Client Server architecture is characterized by a dedicated file server that runs the network, granting other nodes or clients access to resources. The computational and interface-oriented logic are separated rather than the computers themselves. The client executes in a different address space from the server. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: Peer-to-Peer Networking is characterized by _____________________

options.text: Sharing of resources without use of a separate server computer
Need for a network administrator in lieu of the server
Security and integrity of data is better than in client server configuration
Horizontal & vertical scalability of architecture feasible

questions.explanation: Peer-to-Peer networking involves connection of two or more computers and sharing of resourced without any separate server. All the computers share equal responsibility for processing data. No network administrator is required. Security and integrity of data is more vulnerable as compared to client server architecture. Vertical scalability of architecture is not possible since no server is involved. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: What are the features of Middleware ?

options.text: They manage all activities except transporting, queuing and scheduling
They can operate with devices/systems on a single platform alone
They control communication, leaving authentication/delivery to the server
They are software that help clients communicate with server applications

questions.explanation: Middleware are programs which help clients communicate with server applications. They control communication, authentication as well as delivery. They manage transporting, queuing as well as scheduling. They have the capability to work with diverse platforms. Hence, only Option D is correct.

questions.question: What are the features of a co-axial cable?

options.text: The axes of the two conductors in the co-axial cable are different
It comprises a core conductor enclosed by a plastic cladding, a wire mesh & plastic cladding
It is easy to install but has high attenuation loss
It is cheaper than twister pair cables but more expensive than optical fibre cable

questions.explanation: Co-axial cables consist of a central core conductor surrounded by a plastic cladding, an outer wire mesh and a protective outer plastic cladding. The axis of both the conductors is the same & hence the name co-axial. It is easy to install and has low attenuation loss. It is moderately expensive but cheaper than optical fibre cable. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: What are the characteristics of a Twisted pair cable ?

options.text: Comprises 2 separate insulated wires in a twisted pattern that run parallel to each other
Comprises 4 separate insulated wires in a twisted pattern run parallel to each other
Comprises 2 separate insulated wires in a twisted but non parallel pattern
It is a form of unguided transmission media

questions.explanation: Twisted pair cables consist of 2 separate insulated wires in a twisted pattern run parallel to each other. It is a form of guided transmission media with reduced electro magnetic interference. Option A is the only correct option.

questions.question: What are the characteristics of an Optical Fibre cable ?

options.text: It has high integrity and high attenuation over long distances
It has lower carrying capacity as compared to metallic conductors
It has an inner core which works through light based signalling
It consumes more power since signals degrade faster in the system

questions.explanation: C. An Optic fibre cable consists of an inner core made of glass/plastic/polymer/ acrylic which uses light based signalling. It has high integrity as well as low attenuation over long distances. It has higher carrying capacity & consumer lesser power since signals do not degrade as fast as in other systems. Hence, Option C is the only correct option.

questions.question: Which of the following are un-guided transmission media ?

options.text: Optical Fibre Cables
Co-axial cables
Twisted pair cables
Radio Waves

questions.explanation: D. Options A B, C are all instances of guided transmission media wherein data signals are guided through a specific path. Radio waves, on the other hand, are transmitted without any cables & are un-guided. Hence, only Option D is correct.

questions.question: In guided media transmission, signals are propagated through _____________

options.text: Ground wave propagation
Various types of cables
Ionospheric propagation
Line-of-sight propagation

questions.explanation: Options A, C and D are all instances of unguided transmission media wherein data signals are not guided through a specific path. Propagation through cables, on the other hand, is a form of guided media transmission wherein the data signals are guided along a specific path through the cable. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: What is a Hub ?

options.text: It offers intelligence in interpreting data received by it
It is a expensive device for transport of data between devices
Hubs are exclusively passive & cannot do anything with the signal

questions.explanation: A hub is a hardware device that contains multiple independent ports matching the cable type. It does not offer any intelligence in dealing with data received by it. However, an active hub can amplify/regenerate incoming signals before onward transmission. It is relatively inexpensive. The correct answer is in Option A.

questions.question: What is a Switch ?

options.text: It does not offer intelligence in interpreting data received by it
It increases congestion & slows up the network
It is a special type of hub with additional layer of intelligence which reads the MAC address
It is a type of network interface card operating without a switching table

questions.explanation: A switch is a special type of hub with an additional layer of intelligence. It reads the MAC address of each frame received by it and, based upon the switching table, carries out onward transmission to the node to which the frame is addressed. It decreases congestion and speeds up the network. It is not a type of network interface card. The correct answer is in Option C.

questions.question: What are Bridges ?

options.text: Bridges are used to extend or segment networks
Bridges sit within a segment & manage incoming/outgoing data
Bridges cannot block or forward the data
Bridges can forward the data to the relevant address but not block it

questions.explanation: bridge is used to extend or segment networks. It sits between two physical segments & manages the flow of data. It can choose to either block or forward the data. The correct answer, hence, is in Option A.

questions.question: What is a typical feature of a Router ?

options.text: It is a networking device used to forward data packets along networks
It is always a dedicated hardware device & cannot be a computer
It copies the packets to all connected destinations without discrimination
It does not contain any database of network addresses or pathways

questions.explanation: A router is a dedicated networking device or computer system with more than one network interface. It is used to forward data packets along networks utilising its database of network addresses and alternate pathways. It selectively forwards data packets to the next hope in the route to the destination. The correct answer, hence, is in Option A.

questions.question: What is a typical feature of a Gateway ?

options.text: It is necessary for connecting networks with identical protocols
It is a device that translates one data format to another
It translates both the data format as well as the data itself
It is used to forward data packets along networks

questions.explanation: A gateway is a device that translates one data format to another, eg Email gateways. It is useful in connecting networks with different protocols. It does not tinker with the actual data & only translates the data format.. The correct answer is Option B

questions.question: What is typical of Bus topology ?

options.text: Bus topology contains a single hub connecting all nodes
Connects computers on a single circle of cable
Computers are connected on a single backbone cable
In this system, every node is connected to every other node

questions.explanation: In Bus topology, all the computers in the network are connected on a single backbone cable. All the computers in the network receive incoming messages from any other computer; however, only the intended recipient accepts and processes the message. It is not on a single hub or circle of cable and each of the nodes are not connected to each other. The correct answer is Option C.

questions.question: What is typical of Star topology ?

options.text: Contains a central hub or switch to which each node is connected
All the computers are connected to a single backbone hub
Connects computers on a single circle of cable
In this system, every node is directly connected to every other node

questions.explanation: Star topology comprises a system of a central hub or switch to which each node is connected. Separate cables are drawn from each and every node to the central hub. It does not involve a single backbone hub or a single circle of cable. Every node is connected to the central hub or switch and not to each other. The correct answer, therefore, is Option A.

questions.question: What are the features of Ring topology ?

options.text: All the computers are connected to a single backbone hub
Connects computers to a central hub or switch
In this system, every node is directly connected to every other node
It connects computers on a single ring of cable

questions.explanation: D. In star topology, every computer is connected to two other neighbours for communication. Messages travel uni-directionally, either clockwise or anti-clockwise. It does not involve use of a single backbone hub or a central hub/switch. The correct answer, therefore, is Option D. Justification This involves physical connection of every node with every other node. It is rather complex and requires maximum number of cables. However, it is ideally suited for large telecommunication companies or an internet service provider who cannot afford to have a high degree of fault tolerance. It is not connected to a single backbone or hub/switch. The correct answer, therefore, is Option B.

questions.question: What are the features of Circuit switching ?

options.text: Involves temporary connection between 2 devices for transmission duration
Signal transmission can commence even without end-to-end connection establishment
Data transfer can be only through binary data & not through analog/digital voice
Special training/protocol required to handle data traffic

questions.explanation: Circuit switching is a type of communication when temporary physical connection is established between 2 devices for the duration of the transmission session. Signal transmission can commence only after establishment of end-to-end connection. Information transfer can be through binary data as well as analog/digitabl voice. No special training/protocol is required. The correct answer, therefore, is Option A.

questions.question: What are the features of Packet switching ?

options.text: Requires point-to-point connection establishment for transmission
It breaks up a message into smaller packets for transmission
Packets in each message need to travel in the same path & sequence
Since sequential transmission happens, destination devices need not reassemble them

questions.explanation: Packet switching involves the breaking up of a message into smaller packets for transmission session. Since each packet has the destination address, packets need not travel in the same path or sequence; the destination device reassembles them into proper sequence. The correct answer, therefore, is Option B.

questions.question: What are the features of Message switching ?

options.text: Data is stored at switching point & sent forward whenever pathway is available
Data is not stored at switching points & transmitted continuously
Data is transmitted in packets transmitted in the same path & sequence
Physical path establishment is a pre-requisite to transmission

questions.explanation: Message switching or store-and-forward switching involves accumulation of data at switching points and onward transmission as and when pathway is available. No physical path is established in advance between the sender and the receiver. Data is not transmitted in packets. The correct answer, therefore, is Option A.

questions.question: What is multiplexing ?

options.text: Permits sequential transmission of multiple signals on a single carrier
Facilitates transmission of signals in sequence, one at a time
It is the simultaneous transmission of multiple signals on a single carrier
Refers to simultaneous transmission of multiple signals on multiple carriers

questions.explanation: Multiplexing refers to simultaneous transmission of multiple signals on a single carrier (Option C). The other options are factually incorrect.

questions.question: Frequency division multiplexing involves _________

options.text: Assigning non-overlapping frequency ranges to different signals/users
Assigning overlapping frequency ranges to different signals/users
Assigning non-overlapping frequency ranges to a single signal/user
Use of digital technology when the link bandwidth is greater than sum of signal bandwidths

questions.explanation: FDM assigns non-overlapping frequency ranges to different signals/users. It is an analog technique that can be applied when the bandwidth of the link is greater than the combined bandwidth of the signals to be transmitted. Hence, only Option A is correct .

questions.question: Time Division Multiplexing involves ________________

options.text: Primarily analog technology in which several signals/bitstreams are transferred apparently simultaneously
Combination of analog & digital technology in which several signal/ bitstreams are transferred simultaneously
Solely analog technology in which several signals/bitstreams are transferred simultaneously
Division of time domain into several concurrent time slots of fixed length, one for each sub-channel

questions.explanation: TDM involves a type of digital technology (rarely analog) in which several signals/bit streams are transferred apparently simultaneously. In actual practice, however, it uses sub channels & each signal takes turns on the channel . Hence, only Option D is correct

questions.question: Wavelength Division Multiplexing is _____________

options.text: Conceptually similar to Time Division Multiplexing but using various wavelengths of light
Conceptually similar to Frequency Division Multiplexing but uses a single wavelength of light
Conceptually similar to Frequency Division Multiplexing but using various wavelengths of light
Conceptually similar to Time Division Multiplexing and uses a single wavelength of light

questions.explanation: C. WDM is conceptually like FDM and which multiplexes multiple optical carrier signals on a single optical fibre by using different wavelengths of laser light. Hence, only Option C is correct

questions.question: Connection oriented networking involves ________________

options.text: Transmission of data prior to establishment of connection
Establishment of connection prior to data exchange
Simultaneous establishment of connection & data exchange
Networking arrangements based upon priority of connection nodes

questions.explanation: Connection oriented networking involves establishment of connection prior to data exchange. The other options are factually incorrect and, hence, only Option B is correct

questions.question: Connection less networking involves ______________

options.text: Data is exchanged without any prior establishment of connection
Transmission of data after establishment of connection
Simultaneous establishment of connection & data exchange
Exchanged data has no contact information of recipient

questions.explanation: Connectionless networking involves data exchange without any prior establishment of connection. The exchanged data has complete contact information of recipient. The other options are factually incorrect and, hence, only Option A is correct

questions.question: Hardware __________________

options.text: Includes the physical computer as well as all the software loaded on to it
Includes the physical computer as well as the operating system loaded on it
Refers to the tangible portion of a computer
Comprises the cables, the pipes, etc. which carry information in and out of the computer

questions.explanation: As defined clearly in paragraph 1.2.6. Hardware does not include the software loaded on to a computer. It also excludes the operating system, which itself is a piece of software. It is definitely not the cables, pipes, etc. Hence, A,B & D are clearly wrong answers which have no relation to the definition in paragraph 1.2.6

questions.question: Input devices include ______________

options.text: Printer
Cathode ray tube or monitor
board
Speaker

questions.explanation: As defined clearly in paragraph 1.3.1, a Answer:board helps input information into the computer The other devices falling under Options A B & D are all instances of output devices. . Hence, A B & D are clearly wrong answers.

questions.question: Output devices include __________

options.text: Liquid Crystal Display
Microphone
board
Mouse

questions.explanation: As defined clearly in paragraph 1.3.1, a liquid crystal display is a monitor for display or output of information from the computer. Hence it is an output device The other devices falling under Options B to D are all instances of input devices. . Hence, B,C & D are clearly wrong answers.

questions.question: The Arithmetical & Logical unit of the CPU _________________

options.text: Can also be Accumulators
Performs mathematical & logical operations
Can also be Address Registers
Controls flow of data & instructions to and from memory

questions.explanation: As defined clearly in paragraph 1.3.2, The Arithmetic and Logical Control unit performs mathematical and logical operations. The arithmetic & logic unit cannot be called accumulators or address registers. It also does not control flow of data and instructions. Hence, A,C & D are clearly wrong answers.

questions.question: Storage Registers _____________

options.text: Can store memory addresses that tell the CPU where in memory an instruction is located
Can keep running totals of arithmetic values
Can temporarily store data coming from or being sent to system memory
Can help move data from one location in the computer to another

questions.explanation: As defined clearly in paragraph 1.3.2, Storage Registers can temporarily store data coming from or being sent to system memory. Storage Registers do not store memory addresses; this function is carried out by address registers. Arithmetic and logical operations are handled by the Arithmetic & Logical unit of the computer and not the storage register. Lastly, only buses move data from one location of the computer to another. Hence, A, B, & D are clearly wrong answers.

questions.question: Open Systems Interconnection (OSI)_______________

options.text: Deals with interconnection of Open systems software
Is effective in dealing with Open-source software
Deals with communication process without truncation in managing internetwork
Splits communication process to small portions in managing internetwork

questions.explanation: Open Systems Interconnection of OSI is a model which enables integration of various technologies & provides solutions for managing the internetwork environment. It does this by splitting communication processes into small portions. It has nothing to do with Open systems or Open-source software. Hence, only Option D is correct.

questions.question: What is ARPANET ?

options.text: Network of computers in Arabia & Pakistan
New cloud computing network being set up by the U.S.
Computer network set up under auspices of U.S. dept. Of Defence in 1969
Network of the Association of Resource Planners

questions.explanation: ARPANET is a network of computers set up under the auspices of the U.S. dept. Of Defence in 1969 and a precursor to the internet. The answers in options A, B, and D are imaginary & incorrect. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The suite of network protocol TCP/ IP evolved from _______________

options.text: Conventions developed by ARPA
Pioneering work & norm developed by Intel
International conference of global IT experts
Norms developed by Indian IT developers

questions.explanation: The suite of TCP/IP protocol evolved from the conventions developed by ARPANET to specify how individual computers could communicate across a network. The answers in options B, C & D are all imaginary and incorrect. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: Which international body takes a lead role in developing common protocols for the World Wide Web to promote its evolution and ensure its inter-operability ?

options.text: The Internet Society (ISOC)
The Internet Architecture Board
World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)
The Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)

questions.explanation: It is the W3C which handles the role indicated in the question above. The organizations mentioned in the other options handle other responsibilities connected to the internet. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: Which international body handles governance of generic Top Level Domain (gTLD) & other related responsibilities ?

options.text: The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN)
World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)
The Internet Society (ISOC)
The Internet Architecture Board (IAB)

questions.explanation: It is the ICANN which handles the role indicated in the question above. The organizations mentioned in the other options handle other responsibilities connected to the internet. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: Which international body bears the responsibility for technical activities of the Internet, including writing specifications & protocols ?

options.text: World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)
The Internet Society (ISOC)
The Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)
The Internet Architecture Board (IAB)

questions.explanation: It is the IETF which handles the role indicated in the question above. The organizations mentioned in the other options handle other responsibilities connected to the internet. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: Networking Protocol ______________

options.text: Is a set of rules that governs what, how and when data is communicated over a network
Is the set of international norms laid down for country priority in communication over a network
Is the set of international norms laid down for voice data communication alone
Is the set of international norms laid down for use of hardware in a network

questions.explanation: Networking protocol is the set of rules that governs what, how and when data is communicated over a network. The protocol does not prescribe any country priority for network communication. Its coverage is not exclusive to voice data alone. It does not apply to usage of hardware in a network. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: Syntax in Protocol represents __________

options.text: How data is communicated
When data is communicated
What is communicated
What, When & How data is communicated

questions.explanation: Syntax represents only What is communicated. There are other terms which represent the How and the When of data communication. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: Semantics in Protocol represents ________________

options.text: What is communicated
When data is communicated
What, When & How data is communicated
How data is communicated

questions.explanation: Semantics represents only How data is communicated. There are other terms which represent the What and the When of data communication. Hence, only Option D is correct.

questions.question: Timing in Protocol represents _______________

options.text: When data is transmitted but not how fast
The global time zones when data can be transmitted
When data is communicated & how fast
What, When & How data is communicated

questions.explanation: Timing in Protocol represents How data is communicated & how fast. There are other terms which represent the What and the When of data communication. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The Open System Interaction (OSI) reference model ________________

options.text: Makes inter-operability across heterogeneous technology environments possible
Is a 5 layered model, each specifying particular network functions
Is a 9 layered model, each specifying particular network functions
Has layers which are not self-contained & hence, dependent upon other layers

questions.explanation: The OSI model describes how information from a software application in one computer moves through a network medium to a software application in another computer. When messages are sent across heterogeneous networks with a large variety of hardware technologies, networking devices and protocols, etc, OSI makes inter-operability across these differing environments possible. It is a 7 layered model which are quite independent and self-contained. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: In an OSI model, interfaces _______________

options.text: Describe (horizontal) communication between adjacent layers
Describe (vertical) communication between any two layers
Describe (horizontal) communication between any two layers
Describe (vertical) communication between adjacent layers

questions.explanation: In an OSI model, interfaces describe (vertical) communication between adjacent layers. The answers falling in options A to C are factually incorrect. Hence, only Option D is correct.

questions.question: In an OSI model, protocols _____________

options.text: Describe (vertical) communication between adjacent layers
Describe (vertical) communication between any two layers
Describe (horizontal) communication between layers
Describe (horizontal & vertical) communication between adjacent layers

questions.explanation: In an OSI model, protocols describe (horizontal) communication between layers. The answers falling in options A, B and D are factually incorrect & only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The sequence of layers in a typical OSI model is ____________

options.text: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data link, Physical
Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data link, Application
Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Presentation, Application
Physical, Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Application, Physical

questions.explanation: In an OSI model, the sequence of layers is as in Option A. The answers falling in options B to D are factually incorrect & only Option A is correct.

questions.question: TCP/IP protocol suite is a bundle of protocols that area segmented into __________

options.text: Five layers
Seven layers
Nine layers
Six layers

questions.explanation: TCP/IP protocol is segmented into Five layers & only Option A is correct.

questions.question: The sequence of layers in a typical TCP/IP protocol suite is __________

options.text: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data link, Application
Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
Application, Transport, Internet, Data link, Physical
Physical, Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Physical

questions.explanation: TCP/IP protocol is segmented into five layers, sequenced as shown in Option C. The answers falling in options A B and D are factually incorrect & only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The protocol typically used for web browsing is _____________

options.text: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
Hyper Text Transfer Protocol
Simple Network Management Protocol
Domain Name System

questions.explanation: The protocol used for web browsing is HTTP and not the protocols indicated in Options A, C and D. Only Option B is correct.

questions.question: The protocol typically used for sending messages to other computer users based on email addresses is _____________

options.text: Hyper Text Transfer Protocol
Simple Network Management Protocol
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
Domain Name System

questions.explanation: The protocol used for sending messages to other computers using email addresses is SMTP and not the protocols indicated in Options A B and D. Only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The protocol typically used for logging on to a remote server is ___________

options.text: Terminal Network or TELNET protocol
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
Hyper Text Transfer Protocol
Domain Name System

questions.explanation: The protocol used for logging on to a remote server is TELNET and not the protocols indicated in Options B to D. Only Option A is correct.

questions.question: The protocol typically used for transferring files from one computer to another is _______________

options.text: Terminal Network or TELNET protocol
File Transfer Protocol
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
Hyper Text Transfer Protocol

questions.explanation: The protocol used for transferring files from one computer to another is FTP and not the protocols indicated in Options A C and D.. Only Option B is correct.

questions.question: The protocol that allows images, audio & non-ASCII formats to be included in email messages is __________________

options.text: Post Office Protocol
Internet Message Access Protocol
Hyper Text Transfer Protocol
Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions

questions.explanation: The protocol that allows images, audio & non-ASCII formats to be included in email messages is MIME. The other protocols indicated in Options A B and C are not appropriate. Only Option D is correct. Justification One type of protocol used for retrieving email is POP. The other protocols indicated in Options A B and D are not appropriate. Only Option C is correct.

questions.question: One typical characteristic of Transmission Control Protocol is _______________

options.text: It is not responsible for recovery of packets lost during transmission
It is not responsible for re-assembling the message at the other end
It is responsible for recovery of packets lost during transmission
It is not responsible for re-sending anything that is lost in transit

questions.explanation: TCP is responsible for recovery of packets lost during transmission as mentioned in Option C. The choices in other options are factually incorrect. Only Option C is correct

questions.question: Positive Acknowledgement with Re-transmission (PAR), the mechanism that sends data to a recipient repeatedly till it receives a Data OK signal, is an inherent part of _____________

options.text: Transmission Control Protocol
Internet Message Access Protocol
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
Terminal Network Protocol

questions.explanation: PAR is an inherent part of TCP and not the other protocols indicated in Options B to D. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: The objective of Network Layer is _______________

options.text: To provide security by building in fail-safe protection
To decide which physical path the information should follow from source to destination
Accelerate the flow of data through encryption
To validate the data & ensure delivery is completed without errors

questions.explanation: The objective of Network Layer is to decide which physical path the information should follow from source to destination. The answers given in the other options A, C and D are not correct. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: What is Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) ?

options.text: A mechanism to ascertain the IP address given a physical address (MAC)
A method of ascertaining the physical address (MAC), given the IP address
A mechanism to send notification of datagram problems back to sender
A system by which new internet IP addresses can be created

questions.explanation: ICMP is a mechanism to send notification of datagram problems back to sender. It cannot help locate the IP address or physical address, given the other element. Nor can it help create new IP addresses. Hence, only Option C is correct

questions.question: What is Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) ?

options.text: A method of ascertaining the physical address (MAC), given the IP address
A mechanism to ascertain the IP address given a physical address (MAC)
A mechanism to send notification of datagram problems back to sender
A system by which new internet IP addresses can be created

questions.explanation: ARP is a method of ascertaining the physical address (MAC), given the IP address. It cannot help locate the IP address given a physical address. It is also not a mechanism to send notification of datagram problems back to sender. Nor can it help create new IP addresses. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: What is Reverse Address Resolution Protocol (RARP) ?

options.text: A mechanism to ascertain the physical address (MAC), given an IP address
A mechanism to send notification of datagram problems back to sender
A method of ascertaining the IP address, given the physical address (MAC)
A system by which new internet IP addresses can be created

questions.explanation: RARP is a method of ascertaining the IP address, given the physical address (MAC). It cannot help locate the physical address given an IP address. It is also not a mechanism to send notification of datagram problems back to sender. Nor can it help create new IP addresses. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The protocol data unit for Transport layer of TCP/IP is called __________

options.text: A Segment
A Packet
A Frame
A Bit

questions.explanation: The protocol data unit for Transport Layer of TCP/IP is called a Segment; the others refer to names used for other layers. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: The protocol data unit for Network Layer of TCP/IP is called ___________

options.text: A Segment
A Bit
A Packet
A Frame

questions.explanation: The protocol data unit for Network Layer of TCP/IP is called a Packet; the others refer to names used for other layers. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The protocol data unit for Data Link Layer of TCP/IP is called _____________

options.text: A Segment
A Frame
A Packet
A Bit

questions.explanation: The protocol data unit for Data Link Layer of TCP/IP is called a Frame; the others refer to names used for other layers. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: The protocol data unit for Physical Layer of TCP/IP is called ?

options.text: A Packet
A Frame
A Bit
A Segment

questions.explanation: The protocol data unit for Physical Layer of TCP/IP is called a Bit; the others refer to names used for other layers. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The Data Link Layer ____________

options.text: Performs the task of delivery over local networks and error detection
Enables us to find the best way from origin to destination
Runs application to access other layers services & defines protocols
Provides the path through which data moves among network devices

questions.explanation: The Data Link Layer performs the task of delivery over local networks and error detection. The other options refer to functions of other layers of TCP/IP protocol. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: The Application Layer __________

options.text: Performs the task of delivery over local networks and error detection
Provides the path through which data moves among network devices
Runs application to access other layers services & defines protocols
Enables us to find the best way from origin to destination

questions.explanation: The Application Layer runs various applications which provide them the ability to access the services of the other layers and define the protocols that applications use to exchange data. The other options refer to functions of other layers of TCP/IP protocol. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: The Cyclic Redundancy Check ________________

options.text: Is a check conducted by Application Layer
Is a check carried out by the Physical Layer on each stream of bits
Is a calculated value of the Data Link Layer for error detection
Is a check carried out by the Network Layer to identify the shortest route

questions.explanation: The Cyclic Redundancy Check is a calculated value that is place in the Data Link trailer that is added to the message frame. It helps detect errors. The information given in the other options A B and D are incorrect. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: One characteristic of the Physical Layer of TCP/IP is ___________

options.text: The sender and receiver need not be synchronized at the bit level
It deals in zeroes and ones and voltages
The bits need not be encoded into electrical/optical signals for purposes of transmission
Its data unit is called a segment

questions.explanation: The Physical Layer deals in zeroes and ones and voltages. The sender and receiver need to be synchronized at the bit level. The bits themselves need to be encoded as electrical or optical signals before transmission. Its data unit is called a bit. Hence, only Option B is correct.

questions.question: Wi-Fi ____________

options.text: Is a wireless networking technology that uses radio waves
Has typical access range of about 130 metres
Can handle internet connectivity but not to other networks
Is a networking technology that requires physical cable connections

questions.explanation: Wi-Fi is a wireless networking technology using radio waves that can handle both internet and other network connections. The typical range of Wi-Fi is about 32 metres. Being a wireless facility, it does not require any physical cabling for access. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: Bluetooth Technology ______________

options.text: Has typical access range of about 200 metres
Can handle data but not voice transmission
Aims at unifying different platforms & devices
Has a major drawback, that of data security

questions.explanation: Bluetooth technology, a wireless technology for exchange of data over short distances, aims at unifying different platforms and devices. It has a typical range of about 50 metres. Both data as well as voice can be transmitted through it. Data security is fairly good. Hence, only Option C is correct.

questions.question: An IP Network ____________

options.text: Uses Internet Protocol to send/receive messages between computers
Can be implemented only in internet networks
Can operate even in the absence of an IP address
Is designed to function effectively without configuration of the hosts with the TCP/IP suite

questions.explanation: An IP Network uses Inter Protocol to send/receive messages between two or more computers. It can be implemented over internet networks, LAN & enterprise networks. Its fundamental pre-requisites are the need for an IP address to identify the host as also configuration of the host with the TCP/IP suite. Hence, only Option A is correct.

questions.question: IP Addresses _____________

options.text: Are allocated to computer servers alone on the network
Are allocated to client devices alone on the network
Are given by IP Addressing Scheme for identifying hosts
For the destination host alone are contained in every IP packet

questions.explanation: IP addresses are, indeed allocated by the IP Addressing Scheme for every host, whether client, server or network device. While transmitting messages, each IP packet contains both the source host IP address as well as the destination host IP address. Hence, only Option C is correct.
